member.name: T:Squid.RectanglePacker
member.summary: Rectangle packer using an algorithm by Javier Arevalo

remarks.para: Original code by Javier Arevalo (jare at iguanademos dot com). Rewritten to C# / .NET by Markus Ewald (cygon at nuclex dot org). The following comments were written by the original author when he published his algorithm.

You have a bunch of rectangular pieces. You need to arrange them in a rectangular surface so that they don't overlap, keeping the total area of the rectangle as small as possible. This is fairly common when arranging characters in a bitmapped font, lightmaps for a 3D engine, and I guess other situations as well.

The idea of this algorithm is that, as we add rectangles, we can pre-select "interesting" places where we can try to add the next rectangles. For optimal results, the rectangles should be added in order. I initially tried using area as a sorting criteria, but it didn't work well with very tall or very flat rectangles. I then tried using the longest dimension as a selector, and it worked much better. So much for intuition...

These "interesting" places are just to the right and just below the currently added rectangle. The first rectangle, obviously, goes at the top left, the next one would go either to the right or below this one, and so on. It is a weird way to do it, but it seems to work very nicely.

The way we search here is fairly brute-force, the fact being that for most offline purposes the performance seems more than adequate. I have generated a japanese font with around 8500 characters and all the time was spent generating the bitmaps.
Also, for all we care, we could grow the parent rectangle in a different way than power of two. It just happens that power of 2 is very convenient for graphics hardware textures.
I'd be interested in hearing of other approaches to this problem. Make sure to post them on http://www.flipcode.com

member.name: F:Squid.RectanglePacker.packingAreaWidth
member.summary: Maximum allowed width of the packing area

member.name: F:Squid.RectanglePacker.packingAreaHeight
member.summary: Maximum allowed height of the packing area

member.name: M:Squid.RectanglePacker.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: Maximum width of the packing area
Maximum height of the packing area

member.name: M:Squid.RectanglePacker.Pack(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to allocate space for a rectangle in the packing area
member.param: Width of the rectangle to allocate
Height of the rectangle to allocate
Output parameter receiving the rectangle's placement
member.returns: True if space for the rectangle could be allocated

member.name: M:Squid.RectanglePacker.optimizePlacement(Squid.Point@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Optimizes the rectangle's placement by moving it either left or up to fill any gaps resulting from rectangles blocking the anchors of the most optimal placements.
member.param: Width of the rectangle to be optimized
Height of the rectangle to be optimized

member.name: M:Squid.RectanglePacker.selectAnchorRecursive(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches for a free anchor and recursively enlarges the packing area if none can be found.
member.param: Width of the rectangle to be placed
Height of the rectangle to be placed
Width of the tested packing area
Height of the tested packing area
member.returns: Index of the anchor the rectangle is to be placed at or -1 if the rectangle does not fit in the packing area anymore.

member.name: M:Squid.RectanglePacker.findFirstFreeAnchor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Locates the first free anchor at which the rectangle fits
member.param: Width of the rectangle to be placed
Height of the rectangle to be placed
Total width of the packing area
Total height of the packing area
member.returns: The index of the first free anchor or -1 if none is found

member.name: M:Squid.RectanglePacker.isFree(Squid.RectanglePacker.PackingRectangle@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the rectangle can be placed in the packing area at its current location.
member.param: Total width of the packing area
Total height of the packing area
member.returns: True if the rectangle can be placed at its current position

member.name: M:Squid.RectanglePacker.insertAnchor(Squid.Point)
member.summary: Inserts a new anchor point into the anchor list
member.param: Anchor point that will be inserted
member.remarks: This method tries to keep the anchor list ordered by ranking the anchors depending on the distance from the top left corner in the packing area.

member.name: F:Squid.RectanglePacker.actualPackingAreaWidth
member.summary: Current width of the packing area

member.name: F:Squid.RectanglePacker.actualPackingAreaHeight
member.summary: Current height of the packing area

member.name: F:Squid.RectanglePacker.packedRectangles
member.summary: Rectangles contained in the packing area

member.name: F:Squid.RectanglePacker.anchors
member.summary: Anchoring points where new rectangles can potentially be placed

member.name: T:Squid.RectanglePacker.AnchorRankComparer
member.remarks: Anchoring points are potential locations for the placement of new rectangles. Each time a rectangle is inserted, an anchor point is generated on its upper right end and another one at its lower left end. The anchor points are kept in a list that is ordered by their closeness to the upper left corner of the packing area (their 'rank') so the packer favors positions that are closer to the upper left for new rectangles.

member.name: F:Squid.RectanglePacker.AnchorRankComparer.Default
member.summary: Provides a default instance for the anchor rank comparer

member.name: M:Squid.RectanglePacker.AnchorRankComparer.Compare(Squid.Point,Squid.Point)
member.summary: Compares the rank of two anchors against each other
member.param: Left anchor point that will be compared
Right anchor point that will be compared
member.returns: The relation of the two anchor point's ranks to each other
